text: :wave: Me again. Here's a new module that we just added to the marketplace -- a pillar page module that will automatically create links between supporting pieces of content and their pillar page, and even include the correct anchor text. <https://www.HubSpot.com/product-updates/automatically-link-back-to-your-pillar-page-with-the-new-pillar-page-module>
not a big whoop, but in the post regarding this, it is referred to as "pillar module" which already exists.  Should be updated to say "Pillar Page Link"

Appreciate the post <@U87NGNETZ>! I reposted on our internal chat and it sparked some good discussion. Just curious, assuming this is the same module being used on HS's blogs, have you guys seen any significant improvement in session duration or search ranking compared to traditional blog tags?

:wave: So this module would work in exactly the same way as a regular internal link. The convenience of this is that once the post is added to your topic in the SEO Tool, the post would automatically have the back link needed
when i tried to download this to a portal i got an error/failed msg

```
Failed to install product
Looks like something went wrong. We'll redeliver the product soon, but if you continue to see this message after 15 minutes, please contact support.
```
<@U2H3TT8F2> - i just successfully installed
sure that makes you feel better
yep juts got it delivered... totally made me feel better that at least someone has it :slightly_smiling_face:
Will the `topic_cluster_by_content_id` function be added to documentation at all?
<@U6W3H6YN8>
It is actually, just not in the sidebar
Sorry, we will get that in there
lol yea <@U7SL518D6> just pointed it out to me, i was looking at side bar
looks like I’m going to have to deep dive into that function to understand it’s use-case
agreed
I mean I looked at the module HS released and testing it in the preview doesn’t reveal anything
I think you need to have topic cluster and pillar pages setup for it to show properly
yea, topicCluster has me a bit lost as well.
<@UD53A9UUR> Oh, yeah totally read this and thought that there was a pillar page module released months ago. Guess I should have skimmed it more carefully
<@U7SL518D6> anything I can help answer?

well I’m just not certain what it means by topic cluster, I probably just need to get in and actually play around to understand it better.

because my first guess at what a topic cluster might be is kinda like a blog post’s topic list, or the data for making one of those blog topic  web things that were all the rage  years ago.

I get it’s related to the  module you guys made I just don’t understand what the data is supposed to look like i guess.

If I spend a few minutes to play with it I’ll get a better idea of it. just haven’t had a chance yet
:thumbsup: Yeah - it’s related to the SEO/Content Strategy tool, where you can group your content by topic (into a topic cluster) and then use this module to automatically link those related pages
we can make that more explicit in our documentation
interesting - question is the meaning of topic the same as blog topic then or is it something specific to the content strategy tool? could cause confusion if they mean different things
its kind of related but also specific to the tool. For instance you could have a blog topic of HubL but your topic cluster can HubSpot Programming as the main topic and then HubL as a subtopic
You then attach to the subtopic the pages in your blog that are related to the HubL subtopic
The sidebar menu should now have `topic_cluster_by_content_id`

so just watched the SEO topic cluster video.

So does this then essentially create kinda like a listing of “related topics” to the current post? is that the idea?

Hi folks! The long awaited CMS for Developers Certification is up and running. Give it a look and build a sweet cat-themed web page to get your certification. (cat theme optional)
<https://academy.HubSpot.com/courses/cms-for-developers>
this module is specifically to link all those related posts back to a central “pillar page”, but yeah that’s the general idea
Also, big shout out to <@U7SL518D6> for helping kick the tires and being the very first certified cms dev.
nice!
i received a passing grade earlier this week :slightly_smiling_face:
Ah yes, the first lego chicken suit themed practicum. Good stuff.
hahaha
thinking about putting that right in the marketplace
:moneybag:
should make some of the elements of mine available in the marketplace. I mean someone might want to show on their site how many days left till caturday, or want a giant lens flare…
already stole it all!
